intro: Campanula tridens, commonly known as the three-toothed bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in loose racemes, and it prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Campanula tridens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
